column2: Create JSCA reader
column3: Once the JSCA schema schema has been defined, we need to create code to can read schemas following that format. The reader will require the schema schema to be modified to support event handlers as types, properties, etc. are consumed by the reader.

column2: Store Analytic ping events in database
column3: We want to store the events in a database in case the user is offline.

column2: Context info popup blocks code when using mutli-line function invocations
column3: This is showing up particularly when using object literals inside method invocations. It looks like the popup itself needs to follow the row of the current offset; whereas, right now it basically places itself one line below the function invocation start

column2: Prompt for perspective reset if perspective layout/information has changed
column3: We can pull this code from Studio 2. Allow us to version the perspective, and if we up the perspective version, prompt the user if they would like to reset the perspective to a new version.

column2: Close Studio or force update if user attempts to use product past pre-set expiration date
column3: Hardcode in date of June 1, 2011. If the user reaches that date and attempts to use the product, force them to update to a new version, or shut the product down (standalone), or disabled the plugin (if used inside Eclipse)

column2: Refactor all ping related methods to a utility class
column3: For example in newmobileprojectwizard.java. we can extract sendCreateProjectEvent to a utility class

column2: Add preferences for Titanium Desktop and Mobile SDKs
column3: We currently don't have a way for users to adjust where their titanium desktop and mobile sdks are installed.  We will want to initialize them to   Mac: /Library/Application Support/Titanium/  Linux: ~/.titanium/  Win32: %ProgramData%\\Titanium\\

column2: Download latest SDK on initial Titanium Startup
column3: If a user starts Titanium Studio, and does not have a SDK installed, we need to ensure they have one ready. This might be done already--if so, great. Otherwise, let's automatically download and install the latest desktop and mobile SDKs.

column2: Clean doesn't actually clean a mobile project
column3: We need to make "Clean" actually remove the contents of both the build/iphone and build/android directories (but not the directory itself).  This will cause a real clean when you build the project and regenerate compiled files.

column2: Upgrade packaged JRuby to 1.6.0 RC3
column3: They've just released JRuby 1.6.0 RC3, which fixes a bug we saw with some users on Windows with funky default charsets. we should upgrade when possible.

column2: Allow users to download older versions of Mobile SDK
column3: Change "Install Titanium SDK From URL..." to "Install Specific Titanium SDK..."    Add radio button:  * Install from URL: Top text box will stay as before, allowing people to paste in. Add browse button to surf to local location on disk  * Install from Up

column2: Exclude build folder from AppExplorer
column3: When an application is building, you could see constant workspace updating in Progress view.

column2: Keep user signed in for 24 hours since last sign in if offline
column3: Basically, if user goes offline, he currently still could continue to use TiStudio features, but until Studio restart. It would be better to have some grace period if offline.

column2: Splash/Login Screen looks empty if user is already logged in
column3: Screenshot attached. it may be that the page should just be condensed somewhat, since I don't think we need that much space for the username/password fields. Otherwise, can we place something in the blank area that would look fine if the fields are pasted

column2: Hook up language modules to be exported in timanifest file during Desktop packaging
column3: The code for dealing with modules was commented out by me in porting over the Ti Dev 1 packager for Desktop, since we didn't have this in our metadata or anything. We need to re-implement this now that we are keeping track of this.

column2: Enter/Return doesn't being Login on login splash screen
column3: When you first start TI Studio, it brings up a login screen. I entered my credentials, hit Return and... nothing. It should invoke the login button.

column2: Change "username" label to "email address" in splash screen login
column3: The username label is mis-leading. I believe we're always looking for the user's email address they used to register with.

column2: Must be able to set your own Default Project Location
column3: Most developers I know have their own path for their development projects, often which they have been using for many years.  The Ti Studio needs the ability to change the default location to be whatever the end-developer  wants.

column2: JS Content assist is only looking up members of Window for global namespace
column3: When we lookup globals for Content Assist we explicitly look for members of Window. This is wrong, because we also need to look up members of it's supertype Global.

column2: JS Content Assist doesn't contain ECMAScript 5 types/properties
column3: There are no entries for things like JSON.parse, JSON.stringify, Date.now, etc in our metadata.    We need to add metadata for the new items added in ECMAScript 5. See http://kangax.github.com/es5-compat-table/ and http://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-2

column2: Window type is used as global namespace for all JS files
column3: We explicitly make use of "Window" as the assumed global namespace for all JS files. This is only correct if the file is intended to be run inside a browser.    With the use of TiMobile JS and Node.JS, in that environment, "Global" is the type we should b

column2: Hook up a special Content Assist processor for Alloy view XML files

column2: Create a TSS lexer
column3: We need to generate a TSS lexer to feed the parser. See the PEGJS grammar here: https://github.com/appcelerator/alloy/blob/master/Alloy/grammar/tss.pegjs    We'll need to extract a JFlex TSS.lex file from the rules there.

column2: Create a TSS parser
column3: We need to generate a TSS Parser. See the PEGJS grammar here: https://github.com/appcelerator/alloy/blob/master/Alloy/grammar/tss.pegjs    We'll need to generate an LALR grammar from that and then use beaver to generate a parser. We may be able to simply

column2: Create a TSS editor
column3: Once we have a TSS grammar and lexer, we need to create a TSS editor and associate it with *.tss files. We should remove the old association between JSON and *.tss.

column2: Colorize TSS files

column2: Validate TSS file syntax

column2: Change "All" category to "Others" in mobile project wizard

column2: Confirm support for JDK 7
column3: According to a variety of tickets, it _appears_ that JDK 7.0 should work for both Studio and SDK, but we currently require JDK 6. We should confirm JDK 7 works as expected, or correct (if possible) the reasons that prevent it from working.

column2: Platform Configure Wizard: Configure the Android SDK
column3: Once user clicks "Configure" with Android selected, we should download the selected versions from their respective URLs. The progress dialog should indicate the proper progress since we have the control on the process.

column2: Allow user to modify the target and src branch used in generating pull request

column2: Launch the platform configuration wizard at startup if it is the first run
column3: If this is the first time user has launched Studio after installation, we should prompt the platform configuration wizard after Studio starts. For subsequent launches, we should not prompt.

column2: Platform Config Wizard: Make the version string more clear
column3: The current version displayed for each platform in the wizard is just the number and does not indicate clearly what it is for. It should be prepended by say 'Version' or 'SDK'.

column2: Platform Config Wizard: Improve the layout for Advanced Settings section
column3: When the Advanced Settings section is expanded, the section should cover the entire width of the wizard.

column2: Platform Config Wizard: Hide Advanced Settings button and section for iOS
column3: The wizard should allow the ability for a platform to indicate it does not need an Advanced Settings section, e.g. iOS, and hide the section accordingly.

column2: Platform Config Wizard: Not to resize the wizard width when expanding the Advanced Settings section
column3: Currently when the Advanced Settings section is expanded and if the SDK location path is long, the wizard will get expanded to a width enough to show the complete path. That looks jarring. Instead, we should maintain the wizard width and set a width hint

column2: Platform Config Wizard: The "Advanced Settings" text should not appear grayed out
column3: The "Advanced Settings" text should appear normal like for "Hide Settings" when the section is expanded.

column2: Improve performance of Android preference page

column2: When Importing Project, give user option to create a copy of the project directory

column2: Remove help image and link next to unconfigured platforms, use decorators and hover UI from project wizard
column3: The existing UI for unconfigured platforms adds a help/info image which you must click on to view details. Replace with some sort of decorator with details on hover or in some summary section, like we do in the new project wizard.

column2: Add an "Install..." button to the deploy target section. Enable when user has selected an unconfigured platform

column2: Add wrench icon after each configured platform in tiapp editor to open platform prefs, remove "Configure..." link

column2: Enable unconfigured platforms, reduce severity of decorators
column3: We currently disable unconfigured platforms in the listing. We should enable them, but not pre-select them. The severity of all warnings/errors about their not being configured should be reduced to Info icons.

column2: Remove the "Configure SDKs" link
column3: We find the link to be an extreme edge case most users won't need now that we're providing installation of unconfigured platforms inside the wizard.

column2: When unconfigured platform is selected, dynamically add install page as next page

column2: Order Android SDK Versions in Install Wizard sorted vertically, not row with wrapping

column2: Install Wizard: Disable installed Android versions, but select them
column3: Disable installed SDK versions, but select them to indicate they're installed, but can not be uninstalled through the wizard.

column2: Enable unconfigured platforms, reduce severity of decorators
column3: We currently disable unconfigured platforms in the listing. We should enable them, and the severity of all warnings/errors about them not being configured should be reduced to Info icons.

column2: Remove the "Configure SDKs" link
column3: We find the link to be an extreme edge case most users won't need now that we're providing installation of unconfigured platforms inside the wizard.

column2: When unconfigured platform is selected, dynamically add install page as next page

column3: If the CLI is not installed or if it is installed to a location that is not in user's PATH, user will run into a NPE when the provision profiles are loaded. We should better handle such cases.

column3: We currently have two separate update popups/checks: one is the Eclipse p2 update check and will update Studio itself. The second is our own check for updates to NPM packages, the SDK and other modules/components.    This results in an inconsistent UI. We

column2: The default user agents for Alloy and Node.ACS should refer to mobile platforms
column3: The current default preferences for Alloy and Node.ACS project's user agent refers to the browsers such as Chrome, Firefox and IE.    For Titanium and Appcelerator Studio, the default user agent should refer to mobile platforms (such as Android, iOS and o

column2: Studio freezes for a moment when loading Deploy Targets section of tiapp editor
column3: If Studio is closed with an active TiApp editor, then during the restart of Studio, it tries to activate the TiApp editor from the previous session. While it tries to open the TiApp editor, it ends up in loading the Android AVDs and that causes freeze mom

column2: Clean up icons in the global toolbar
column3: We want to go through each icon in the global toolbar and remove the ones rarely used by users. The suggestion is to remove the following:    # Save  # Save All  # Print  # Theme  # Run/Debug/Profile/Test related actions (since we will re-design them in T

column2: By default do not show text for the list of open perspectives in global toolbar
column3: Momentics has the "Show Text" off by default, and it saves space in global toolbar.

column2: Editor: remove the black folding gutter or color it correctly
column3: We should find a way to not have the black gutter affect the visual appeal.

column2: Remove App Explorer
column3: The feeling is App Explorer doesn't add compelling value and feels redundant next to Project Explorer. We will hide/deprecate it from default Studio perspectives but keep the plugin.

column2: Remove Local Filesystem from Project Explorer
column3: It is unlikely user would use Studio to browse local filesystem, and Titanium development is very much project-based, so we should remove the node for Titanium/Appcelerator Studio. We will still keep it for Aptana Studio.

column2: Enable global toolbar for the simple Studio perspective
column3: Once we clean up the global toolbar and add the new UI for device profile, we should re-enable global toolbar for the simple perspective.

column2: Default to only applying theme to editor
column3: A suggestion is to only have the dark theme applied to editor. There is currently a preference to apply theme to all views, so maybe set it to false by default?

column2: Syntax error appears on unexpected line
column3: See screenshot. There is an unfinished line "Ti.API.", but the error doesn't appear until a few lines below at "catch (e)". And the error message "Syntax Error: unexpected token 'catch'" isn't really clear on the real error either.

column2: Re-skin Studio appearance
column3: Chris presented a theme/skin that got raves from everyone. We should add it in Studio and make it the default. Once we receive additional feedback, we could tweak the default as needed.

column2: Remove the thick dark stroke under global toolbar
column3: See screenshot. There is a dark line under the global toolbar that we should try to remove or re-theme as part of TISTUD-5477.

column2: Profile TiApp editor for expensive operations that should be run on non-UI threads
column3: We should run a profile session on opening TiApp editor and locate the bottleneck. Once located, we should move those operations to be run off the UI thread and have some indication to say the tiapp is loading.

column2: Investigate and if necessary, improve the loading time of Build Properties section in TiApp
column3: Investigate if loading tiapp's Build Properties section needs to be improved, and if so, move the time-consuming task to non-UI thread.

column2: When doing ti info queries for devices/emulators, use --sdks arg to force latest version of SDK (>= 3.2.0)
column3: We don't specify the sdk version and versions < 3.2.0 won't give us the info we want with the full listing. So in IOS and Android SDKLocators when we call out to ti info, add a "--sdks" arg and pass along the latest mobile SDk version available.

column2: When there is no installed version of titanium SDK >= 3.2, don't do periodic query of devices/emulators
column3: Older versions of the CLI/SDK don't give us the info, so there's no need to query periodically. We do need to remember to kick off the querying again if a newer SDK is installed after the fact.

column2: Add code coverage to development branch builds (not just nightlies)
column3: We currently record code coverage for nightly builds and PHP/Ruby. We should add code coverage to the normal development branch builds:  - studio3-core-development  - appcelerator-core-development  - titanium-core-development

column2: Enforce code coverage doesn't drop for normal development builds
column3: Once we have code coverage recorded for the three normal builds that run unit tests, we should enforce the coverage never drops like we do for nightlies. This way we can catch if a commit will break the build because of this earlier in the process.

column2: Add code coverage to PR builders
column3: We should enable tracking code coverage on the PR builders.

column2: Enforce that PR builders code coverage doesn't drop or they fail
column3: Once the mainline builds and PR builders are recording code coverage results, we should enforce that the PR doesn't pass unless it builds, passes all the tests and doesn't drop coverage from the current level on the target merge branch.

column2: Switch to using Findbugs rank over priority
column3: Findbugs (and the Jenkins plugin) defaults to using "priority" for sorting issues into high/normal/low. The reality is that "priority" was defined as closer to "confidence level" in the way it's used.  With Findbugs 2.0 they introduced "rank" which is the

column2: Merge build job definitions from development to release
column3: We have our jobs set up differently between release/master and development (different number of builds, different dependencies). Once we being merging the code over we also need to merge the build definitions on jenkins from development to release.

column2: Move Openshift code out to separate repo
column3: We currently have the openshift code in the titanium core repo. It has no dependencies on titanium at all right now (just studio3 core), and it's highly inactive in terms of development. We also don't ship it as part of titanium studio. We should just mov

column2: Move Testflight out to it's own repo
column3: Testflight is a separate feature and one we don't ship in titanium by default. It should be moved out to its own repo so it doesn't constantly rebuild when we check in to titanium core.

column2: Move Nukona out to it's own repo
column3: Nukona is a separate feature and one we don't ship in titanium by default. It should be moved out to its own repo so it doesn't constantly rebuild when we check in to titanium core. I'm not even sure it does anything right now.

column2: Update content assist to support FixedSpace tag
column3: Alloy 1.4 adds support for shortcut notation for a fixed space button. <FixedSpace> is a shortcut for <Button systemButton=‚ÄúTi.UI.iPhone.SystemButton.FIXED_SPACE>. This is supported on iOS only.

column2: Update content assist to support shorthand notation for left and right navigation buttons

column2: Alloy: enable developers to create new widget components

column2: Update content assist to support setting ActionBar properties via the Menu tag
column3: Alloy 1.4 adds support for setting Android ActionBar properties (title, subtitle, etc.) as attributes of the <Menu> tag. This change affects Android only.

column2: Update content assist to support shorthand notation for keyboard and return key types

column2: Always run CLI commands with trace level
column3: The info-level log output is insufficient for debugging issues with Titanium builds. Always run CLI commands with trace level output and then filter the output on-the-fly in the console window. This way the log output always has the trace level log output

column2: Prevent a build from running if its ancestors are in queue or running
column3: E.g.  B depends on A  if B is triggered whilst A building, B trigger is ignored.    This will mean that further checkins against B won't run.    Have to be optional.  Must only block if the parent is the same revision as the child that is about to build,

column2: User can configure dependency blocking
column3: Applicable per child plan  User can configure whether dependency children are blocked from building when ancestors are running.

column2: Check ancestors of a build when it is triggered and prevent building if changes found (in ancestors) Ancestors are kicked off
column3: E.g.  B triggered, whilst A is not building. Check A, if changes found in A, build A, don't build B.    What if A is a manual and dependent builds only? or a schedule build?    Ignore the trigger for now. Later optimizations needed.

column2: If AJS.conglomerate.cookie gets too big, web servers will report HTTP error 413
column3: As an Administrator edits the plans, the *AJS.conglomerate.cookie* stores the UI history. However, Bamboo is not resetting the cookie value often enough to avoid it getting too big.    This causes the web/app server to report HTTP error 413.

column2: Unit test failure during Clover2 custom lifecycle do not fail builds

column2: Change default sort order in coverage report for packages/classes/methods

column2: Rename ClassInfo to TypeInfo

column2: Rename StatementInfo to ExpressionInfo

column2: Unicode 0x200B (zero-width whitespace) causes instrumentation failure
column3: JDK 6 implements Unicode 4.0. In this version of Unicode, the zero-width whitespace character (0x200B) is being treated as a whitespace.    JDK 7 implements Unicode 6.0. In this version of Unicode, the zero-width whitespace has been reclassified to the 'f

column2: Identify test data and camera

column2: Generate use case

column2: Sync test data headers with standards
column3: The headers will need to be vetted against known FITS standards.  The headers should be valid and should not contain any non-standard keywords.  There should also be a census of FITS standards that may be used for defining sensor layout.

column2: Implement a tool to generate a Camera from FITS images
column3: Implement the tool to generate the camera object.  It should be a command line tool that will take a path to a file.  It should have an option to persist the generated camera.  It should also have the ability to plot the camera.

column2: Verify use of the tool with the camera team
column3: We will need to run the tool in the camera team's system to make sure the interfaces are as they expected.  It will also help to make sure that the tool addresses all of the cases.

column2: Design the API
column3: The API will have to be able to accommodate data we know about, so will need to deal with reasonable missing data.  It should also not preclude extension.  This will need to be RFC'd since it is an API change.

column2: Implement and test the new API
column3: Once the API is designed and signed off on, the API will need to be implemented and tested.  This will require updating all obs_* packages that use the current interface.

column2: Do basic tests of CModel ellipticity measurements

column2: Simultaneous astrometry requirements
column3: The HSC group needs improvements to the simultaneous astrometry fitter delivered by Astier et al.  In particular we'll need to do simultaneous photometry as well.  This epic is to determine the superset requirements for such a system.

column2: Refactor Jointcal to use stack functionality
column3: Jointcal currently has a lot of built-in features that already exist elsewhere in the stack (e.g. GTransfo, StarSelector, Points, etc.). These features should be removed and replaced with the equivalent stack functionality.

column2: Implement simultaneous photometry
column3: The simultaneous astrometry framework should be able to be extended to also fit the photometry at the same time.  This task is to do just that.  The task to create a pluggable framework should help with this.

column2: Clean up Wcs classes
column3: The Wcs classes as they currently exist are not easy to extend and also contains overrides that are a bit ad hoc.  This task is to clean up the existing classes so that there is a single abstract base class.  It should also be a priority of this task to d

column2: Gather requirements for improved Wcs classes
column3: The new Wcs class should be able to apply transforms in a stack so that many different distortions as different scales can be corrected for separately (rather than trying to correct the whole mess with a single 2D polynomial).  There is some work going on

column2: Produce a design for the new Wcs classes
column3: This will require generating a design as well as getting it reviewed via RFC.  The hope is that other work can be ongoing while the RFC process is carried out.

column2: Implement new Wcs classes
column3: Once a design is accepted implement the new design. This epic covers the replacement of afw:image:wcs with afw:transform/afw:mapping (names currently in flux), but does not involve changes to XYTransform.

column2: Make Wcs persistable
column3: Regardless of the mechanism used by the new Wcs classes, they will need to be persistable.  This will probably require some significant work unless classes that are already persistable are used in the design.

column2: Identify all corrections ISR needs to handle
column3: This is informed by DECAM etc.  This is just for the corrections that do not require detection.  For example, we will push out CR rejection until the question of snaps is decided.

column2: Implement all ISR corrections for LSST
column3: Most corrections have some implementation.  Perhaps the most difficult will be crosstalk since the implementation should allow for correction over multiple chips.

column2: Make up a test for dipole measurement
column3: To facilitate work on the dipole measurement, a test will be helpful.  This could simply be an image with dipoles made with Gaussian PSFs with Poisson noise on top.  The important thing is to be able to determine whether the algorithm is returning the rig

column2: Improve the dipole measurement task
column3: The current dipole measurement algorithm has some issues.  It also doesn't work in the current measurement framework.  This task is to improve the dipole measurement.  The result of this epic should be improved results when run on the test data.

column2: Gather requirements to inform a redesign of the CalibrateTask
column3: The current calibrate task is fairly brittle and hard to extend.   This task is to gather the necessary requirements for a redesigned calibrate task.

column3: Implement the redesigned CalibrateTask.

column2: Make DipoleFitPlugin mask-safe
column3: The DipoleFitPlugin does not correctly handle bad pixels and other masks/flags. Make it so it does so, and make tests to ensure it does so.

column2: Literature research on image subtraction algorithms

column2: Assessment of current state-of-the-stack diffim implementation

column2: Remove use of Boost smart pointers throughout the Science Pipelines

column2: Suppress gcc warnings about "unused local typedefs"

column2: Finish technical note on galaxy shear experiments
column3: In the review of DM-5447 we decided it made sense for [~jbosch] to take over finishing the technote, in particular providing an introduction and concluion with more context.

column2: Create focus script
column3: In DM-3368, we stripped out the focus calculation since it's not camera-generic, and the scatter/gather isn't necessary for general processing.  We need to reinstate the focus calculation in its own scatter/gather script.

column2: Refactor DipoleFitPlugin classification into separate Classification plugin
column3: Currently the new DipoleFitPlugin runs measurement and then classification from a single measurement method. The classification should be moved out to a separate plugin. This will require more information be stored in the measRecord, in order to do the cl

column2: Remove qmeta::QueryId and use global qserv::QueryId
column3: Remove the qmeta::QueryId and use the typedef of QueryId in global/intTypes.h instead. Also try to verify that QueryId is used instead of uint64_t where applicable.

column2: Replace the heap in ScanScheduler with a list.
column3: ScanScheduler is using heaps to order Tasks by chunkId. This makes it difficult to add Tasks to actively running chunks, which causes a significant delay to the start of query execution. Using a list of buckets of Tasks where each bucket is for one chunkI

column2: Alter the worker thread pool to allow threads to leave the pool and continue.
column3: There are times when it is desirable for a thread to continue but effectively leave the thread pool and be considered finished by the scheduler. util::ThreadPool needs to modified to do this.

column2: After the first result set is returned, have the thread leave the pool.
column3: When large results are returned from the worker to the czar, the thread should leave the thread pool and the Task should indicate to the scheduler that it is done.

column2: Add code to the czar to throttle incoming large results.
column3: The czar needs code to limit the number of Tasks sending back large results at any given time.

column2: Fix circular references in Mapper objects
column3: Whilst running tests with pytest and the new file descriptor leak checker it became clear that Mapper objects were not freeing their resources when they were deleted. In particular, the registry objects remained and the associated sqlite database files we

column2: Add "everything" scan
column3: Add a low priority ScanScheduler to the worker to handle very slow scans or scans that do not  work well on the other schedulers.

column2: Add ability for workers to switch slow queries to the everything scan.
column3: Give the workers the ability to move user queries to the everything scan if they are taking too long to complete a Task or several Tasks.

column2: Fix scheduler delays caused by mlock call in memman.
column3: Locking tables in memory with mmap and mlock greatly increases scan query speeds but makes the worker scheduler unresponsive to interactive queries. This also tends to have only one scheduler (fast, slow, medium) running at a given time.

column2: Bulk Image Conversion: failure due to Hadoop AMI upgrade

column2: Media Streamer: Allow streaming of multiple spaces
column3: This task is to allow the user to select multiple spaces for the media streaming service to stream.

column2: Synctool: selective sync-ing
column3: This improvement should allow the user to selectively sync specific files based on subdirectories, prefixes, and/or suffixes using the synctool.

column2: Media Streamer: Stream files added to a space

column2: Revisit build from source

column2: Single Use Access URLs

column3: Service reports that appear in the service-output space need to have an additional differentiator so that services that are run multiple times in one day do not overwrite one another.

column2: Bulk Bit Integrity Service: post-processing in hadoop

column2: Notification/Email utility
column3: This feature is to expose a utility for sending emails. It should consist of both a general interface project and a corresponding implementation project.

column2: Remove interim bulk-bit-integrity manifests
column3: This improvement is to remove from the service output space the interim manifests that the bulk-bit-integrity service creates once the final report has been created. These manifests are: bit-integrity-metadata-results.csv bit-integrity-results.csv

column2: Service Report: backend utility for currently running services

column2: Limit time that can be spent spinning on a mapper task within hadoop

column3: This task is to remove the user-management capabilities ("Adminstration" tab) from Duradmin, since this functionality is being moved up the the account-management-app.

column2: Run-away service monitor
column3: This task is to create a script/application that monitors DuraCloud accounts for long-running bulk services and sends an email alert upon detection.

column2: Azure Storage Provider - adding content and specifying a checksum
column3: When a checksum is provided upon adding content to Azure, ChecksumInputStream was incorrectly trying to calculate the checksum from the provided stream.  The provided checksum should be used instead of calculating it from the stream.

column3: This task is to create a sample ServiceClient analogous to the Sample StoreClient.

column2: Bit Integrity Service: support retries of interrupted content downloads
column3: This task is to add retries to the bit-integrity-service when a content item that is downloaded to calculate its MD5 does not match the expected MD5 from metadata.

column2: Security over UserDetailsService.getUsers()

column2: UI shortcuts which are not useful should be disabled
column3: Holding shift + one of the arrow keys does odd things to the display. These shortcuts should be disabled.

column2: Migrate SCM to Git
column3: This task is to migrate the DuraCloud SCM from Subversion to Git.

column2: Rename spaces
column3: This task is to make it possible for users to rename DuraCloud spaces. In order to do this, space names will need to no longer be directly tied to the bucket/container names of the underlying storage provider. One way to do this is for the name of a space

column2: Archive-It Integration
column3: This feature is to provide an integration with Archive-It so that users with Archive-It content may seamlessly push their collection into DuraCloud.

column2: UI - Provide hierarchical content view
column3: DurAdmin should be able to graphically display folder and file hierarchies in a similar fashion that is available on a local machine. Currently, the naming convention to indicate hierarchical files (ex. folder1/folder2/folder3/filename.txt) is not suffici

column2: Long-running content actions
column3: This task is to add support in DuraStore for long-running actions that can be run over content. Some examples of these kinds of tasks are: multi-file delete, multi-file copy (within and between providers), and multi-file property add/update/delete. It may

column2: Integrate working version of CloudSync
column3: This task is to pull in an updated version of CloudSync into the cloudsyncservice that does not have the issue of not being able to connect to a DuraCloud instance.

column2: Upload tool web deployment
column3: This feature is to establish a means of deploying the UploadTool via Duradmin as a signed-applet, webstart app, or other.

column2: Automatically insert logo in x-duracloud-admin
column3: When a DuraCloud instance is deployed, it should automatically include a logo in the x-duracloud-admin space, so that the logs don't get junked up. I have attached a possible logo to use for this purpose.

column2: Implement an automated performance testing framework
column3: Assemble a framework for automated performance testing to fit into the DuraCloud software engineering process. This framework is to include tests and test data sets. It will be implemented incrementally in an agile fashion.  The primary goal of performanc

column2: Update Sync Tool to take advantage of improvements due to the Upload Tool
column3: The creation of the Upload Tool included several back-end changes to the Sync Tool. This task is to make improvements to the front-end of the Sync Tool to: - Display the progress of file transfers when printing status - Allow for individual files to be wa

column2: Upload tool applet cannot be used at the same time on spaces of the same name on different providers
column3: If you are using the upload tool via DurAdmin to perform an upload on Amazon in space "test", you cannot also perform an upload to a space with the same name in another provider - you are sent to the existing upload window.

column2: ACL: Create UI for managing ACL users/groups during space administration
column3: This feature is to create a UI in duradmin for managing space-level ACLs. It will likely be a button in the righthand pane, similar to the "edit" button for space metadata. The functionality should enable Admins to add/remove 'users' and/or 'groups' to th

column2: ACL: Update StoreClient with setSpaceACL()
column3: This feature should add the new method to the StoreClient: setSpaceACL() This method should take a spaceId and a map of 'usernames' and/or 'groupnames' and their associated privilege (read or write), and set the ACL for the given space.

column2: ACL: Update DuraStore security to ACL rules
column3: This feature should update the durastore spring security definitions to limit access as defined in: https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/DSPINT/Space+Level+ACLs+-+design

column2: Space and content list reload
column3: Please add a refresh button to the space listing as well as to the content listing within a space. Currently a space is not reloaded after content items are added, and a user must either (a) reload their entire browser window or (b) click on the space tab

column2: ACL: Update app-config and security-user bean to include 'group' details
column3: This update is to modify app-config, SecurityUserBean, and security-users.xsd, as appropriate to support the inclusion of ACL 'groups' during instance initialization.

column2: ACL: Add ACLStorageProvider
column3: This feature is to add a new StorageProvider wrapper implementation to facilitate filtering the spaces listed in a getSpaces() request. The primary objectives are to: - provide a way to only return spaces that are either 'open' or are accessible to the ca

column2: ACL: Enable multi-map content/space properties
column3: This feature is to enable multi-map header values throughout the application for content and space properties. The capability should be enabled for the entire stack: storageproviders, to REST, to StoreClient, to Duradmin.

column2: UI Copy Single Content Item Across Storage Providers
column3: NULL

column2: ACL: Update duradmin UI to exclude tabs from USER role
column3: This update is to not display the "Services" tab nor the reports tabs under "Dashboard" if the user who is logged into duradmin only has ROLE_USER. Rather, only users with ROLE_ADMIN should be able to see the services and reports tabs.

column2: ACL: Represent space access (open/closed) as an ACL
column3: This improvement is to refactor the implementation of space access from the 'space-access' property to an ACL property (acl-group-public). In addition to cleaning up specialized logic for space access, handling space access as an ACL will allow a single c

column2: UploadTool changes ACLs on upload
column3: This bug is that when running the UploadTool, the existing ACLs of a space are replaced by a single ACL of {user=w}.

column2: Deprecate space-access methods
column3: This improvement is to deprecate the setSpaceAccess and getSpaceAccess methods on the StorageProvider and ContentStore interfaces.

column2: Provide a REST call to allow administrators to retrieve a listing of all users and groups
column3: In order to be able to create an ACL for a space, an administrative user needs to list all of the users and groups which should have access to the space. What makes this hard is that there's no way via the REST API for an administrator to get a list of th

column2: Sort permissions display
column3: This task is to sort the listing of items in the Permissions section of the content item display in DurAdmin.  Groups should be displayed above users, and both sets should be sorted alphabetically (A-Z). The "public" group, when added, should always be di

column2: Handle space properties cache loading on instance initialization
column3: Currently, the cache for space properties is loaded the first time a user attempts to access a storage provider. If this user is a non-admin user, and there are many spaces in the account, this action can take several minutes. This task is to transition t

column2: Show only writable spaces in the copy content dropdown (in the copy dialog)
column3: NULL

column2: Multi-space property editing:  User should be alerted if they are trying to update one or more readonly spaces.
column3: Suppose a user is looking at a list of four spaces and suppose he has write access to only three of them. Currently the set of editable tags and properties is gathered from all selected spaces regardless of whether the user has write access. Similarly if

column2: Create Messaging over setSpaceACLs()
column3: This improvement is to add messaging over the durastore calls to StorageProvider.setSpaceACLs(). The configuration for this is in: durastore/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/config/aop-config.xml A new advisor (ala SpaceUpdateAdvice) will needed to be created as w

column2: Copying content from Amazon to another provider produces unnecessary properties
column3: When performing a content copy from Amazon to another provider, the resulting content item includes duplicate copies of "default" content properties, such as mimetype and checksum. This task is to filter out these properties when performing a copy.

column2: Add "Help Desk" link to footer
column3: Please add the text "Help Desk" to the footer before the "Contact Us" link. It should link to: http://duracloud.kayako.com.

column2: Remove Duradmin's dependency on the Space Access APIs in storeclient
column3: Remove the dependencies on space access by having duradmin use the acls instead.  It is also necessary to make it clear to the user how to enable public access on a space if no public acl has been set. Additionally the public group should be highlighted i

column2: Synctool: not re-syncing content deleted from DuraCloud
column3: This issue is to fix the bug demonstrated in the following scenario: # run synctool pushing one or more files to a space ** observe success # delete one of the content items in DuraCloud newly pushed to the space # re-run the synctool ** observe deleted i

column2: /init resource should be available to ROLE_USER
column3: This item is to address the bug that only anonymous users can inspect durastore, duraservice, and durareport. ROLE_USER and ROLE_ADMIN should also be able to make such an inspection.

column2: Links into the djatoka viewer are broken in duradmin
column3: Links into the djatoka viewer are broken in duradmin. For example the following url doesn't work:  http://174.129.12.28/adore-djatoka-p18080/viewer.html?rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fdanny.duracloud.org%3A80%2Fdurastore%2Fimage-transformer-dest%2FSunset.png%3Fstore

column2: Content image does not refresh after clicking "Make space public" button.
column3: To reproduce:  1. Make sure image service is running. 2. In duradmin browse to an image content item in a non-public space. 3. Click the make space public button. 4. Notice: the image is not visible.  5. Also note that the warning message  is not automati

column2: January 2012 completed reports are not showing up in duradmin dashboard.
column3: To reproduce, run a service to completion and then observe in the duradmin dashboard that it as well as another other service run after January 1st is not being displayed in the dashboard.

column2: Sync tool: Create a file transfer log
column3: This task is to update the sync tool such that it creates and updates a textual transfer log including all files which are added or updated in DuraCloud along with their checksum. This file would only include files which were successfully transferred to D

column2: Verify that pointing multiple subdomains to a single instance does not cause issues
column3: This task is to perform tests against a DuraCloud instance where multiple subdomains are pointed. One subdomain will be used to initialize the instance, while others will be used to access the UI and APIs. This is intended to simulate the interaction that

column2: Ensure that client tools continue to function across minor outages
column3: This task is to test the DuraCloud client tools (primarily Sync Tool and Retrieval Tool) and make updates that are necessary to allow the tools to continue to run even if the DuraCloud instance becomes unavailable for a short period of time. The period of

column2: Distinguish service-failures from failed-service-results for Non-Hadoop Services
column3: Same as https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/DURACLOUD-512 but for non-hadoop services that operate on lists of items.

column2: When editing multiple space properties,  it is possible for users to attempt to update read only spaces.
column3: To reproduce this problem:  1. select a writeable spaceA and  read-only spaceB (using the checkboxes) 2. click edit properties 3. add a tag or name value pair and save.  4. duradmin displays the error dialog (unauthorized action error)

column2: When logged in as a non-admin,  the multi-space delete button should not be visible.
column3: To reproduce:  1. log in as a user 2. select a space or two using the checkboxes in the spaces list. 3. confirm that a delete button is visible.

column2: Verify the SDSC storage provider integration
column3: This task is to ensure that the SDSC storage provider works as expected, that content can be stored and retrieved, and that everything looks as it should on the SDSC side. Tests should be conducted to verify that all DuraCloud APIs work as expected when e

column2: Set expiration policies for log spaces
column3: This task is to use Amazon's management console for each of the current DuraCloud accounts to set an expiration policy on the x-service-work space to remove all content items with the "logs" prefix after 30 days.

column2: Create and test 64-bit AMI
column3: This task is to: 1. Test the DuraCloud software on a 64-bit instance, to ensure that it works properly, and fix any problems that are discovered 2. Create a production 64-bit AMI as part of the release cycle

column2: Various DurAdmin updates

column3: Update the following items in DurAdmin:   - Change "Space ID" and "Content ID" to "Space Name" and "Content Name" respectively - In the footer of every DurAdmin instance page, ensure that DuraCloud has the "c" capitalized. - In the footer of every DurAdmi

column2: DurAdmin: restrict access to Administration tab
column3: This task is to limit the Administration tab in DurAdmin to be viewable only by root users.

column2: Move storage reports onto spaces tab
column3: This task is to break out the information in the storage reports and display it instead on the main Spaces tab. The space-specific charts should be included on the Space Detail page. The provider-specific charts should be displayed in the detail area that

column3: To reproduce:  1. Run the bulk uploader in duradmin. 2. Select a jpg with a # mark in the filename such as test#1.jpg. 3. Select a jpg with without a # mark in the filename such as test2.jpg. 4. Upload files. 5. Refresh space in duradmin 6. Verify that th

column3: To reproduce:  1. as admin,  remove write access to all spaces within storageProviderA. 2. as user, login, select a content item, click copy, and select storageProviderA.  3. Verify that the destination space drop down is empty. 4. click ok.   5. verify t

column2: Make the image thumbnails in duradmin larger and improve the layout.
column3: When viewing an image in a public space with the image server service running, make the thumbnail larger and center the layout.

column2: Add Space Dialog
column3: This task is to address the following bug: When selecting "Add Space", the flyout allows for entering the new space name. When hitting the "enter" key instead of the "Add" button, a pop-up with the following error is displayed: error: space is undefined

column2: Exception on Space Delete
column3: This task is to fix the bug that causes an exception to be thrown when deleting a space either in duradmin or via the REST api. With any storage-provider, when deleting a space in duradmin, a pop-up with the following message is displayed: failed to delet

column2: Duplicate on Change at Space-Level

column2: Display bit integrity results on each space
column3: Services are being automated and users are no longer required to run the bit integrity service themselves, but they still need to know that their content is being verified. This task is to include on the UI, likely in the space details area, an indication

column2: Refactor RackspaceStorageProvider to OpenStackStorageProvider
column3: This improvement is to refactor the RackspaceStorageProvider to OpenStackStorageProvider. Since we currently have three storage-providers that all expose an OpenStack API, the RackspaceStorageProvider (which is coded to the OpenStack API) should now be ab

column2: Streaming URL for spaces streamed by the Media Streamer
column3: Release 2.0 added the ability for users to select a button on a space and turn on media streaming for that space. This task is to ensure that the streaming URL provided by the Media Streamer service is added to the metadata of the space when it is being s

column2: Media Streamer: remove Viewer space
column3: Since services will no longer be run directly by users, there is no longer a need for the Media Streamer service to produce the contents of the Viewer space. Those generated files are not used as part of the service, they are only provided as examples for

column2: Sync and Retrieval Tool encryption support
column3: After encryption support is added to the StoreClient, the Sync and Retrieval tools need to be updated to allow the user to choose to enable content encryption and to supply the necessary encryption key.

column2: Add user-id to content messaging
column3: This improvement is to include the authenticated user-id of the user performing content actions over the durastore API. At the least, the user-id needs to be included on the ingest event message.  This is in support of the DfR: Object Creation Service.

column2: Update Media Streamer Service to not Require Sources
column3: This task is to remove the requirement of the media streamer service to have a source space.

column2: show content manifest head in space detail with link to full manifest
column3: The purpose of this feature is to guide the user to the content manifest for the space as well as enable them to peek at the recent activity.  The "peek" might be equivalent to head -10 audit-log.

column2: Snippet Generator for Streaming Content
column3: It would be nice to have way to generate a snippet for streaming audio/video  that can be embedded directly into any page.

column2: Formatting on "upload-tool" space

column3: This task is to create a java client (similar to storeclient, serviceclient, and reportclient) to simplify interactions with the Executor REST API.

column2: Add manifest client
column3: This task is to create a Java client for calling the manifest REST methods in DuraBoss.

column2: Consolidate DuraBoss Interfaces

column2: Make charts zoomable
column3: Space pie charts should be zoomable, displaying a larger graph in an overlay.

column2: Make Spaces pie charts navigable
column3: Space slices in the cross spaces pie charts should be clickable.  On click, the user should navigate to the same time slice but on the space detail history component.

column2: Executor: Media Streaming
column3: This task is to implement the Media Streaming Handler in the Executor. Design notes can be found here: https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/DSPINT/DuraBoss+Design

column2: Executor: Bit Integrity Checking
column3: This task is to complete the Bit Integrity Handler in the Executor. Design notes can be found here: https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/DSPINT/DuraBoss+Design

column2: Create Auditor Client
column3: This task is to create a java client (similar to storeclient, serviceclient, and executorclient) to simplify interactions with the Auditor REST API.

column2: SystemUserCredential Across Webapps

column2: Merge common-notification into notification project

column2: Newly uploaded content items do not show up on clicking the space.
column3: To reproduce:   1. Open a space. 2.  Upload content into a space. 3. Click on the space again in the space list. 4. Notice the newly uploaded content is not showing up.

column2: Add multiple tags at once to spaces and content
column3: It should be possible to enter multiple tags at once. A tag should not contain spaces. Let us modify the UI so that you can enter a list of space or comma separated words that get entered as separate tags.

column2: Tag and Metadata deletes are not being serialized
column3: Tag and Metadata deletes are not being serialized. If one deletes multiple tags/key value pairs in rapid succession, you'll notice that some items that were deleted reappear upon refresh.   Solution:  use deferreds to serialize calls.

column2: Deselecting all content items after having selected one or more does not cause the detail pane to show the space detail as it should.
column3: To reproduce:   1. select a content item using the checkbox. 2. deselect it. 3. notice the space detail pane is not being displayed.

column2: The checkbox used to select all items in the content items list should be cleared when selecting another space
column3: 1. select a space. 2. select all content items. 3. select another space. 4. notice the "select all" check box is still checked.

column2: Refactor revision 914 so that it is not necessary to resolve the primary content store id on every call to get space and content detail info
column3: Probable solution will involve caching the primary content store on the client.

column3: To reproduce:  1. Display a space 2. Make the Space Detail pane wider. 3. Note how the line graph labels are skewed.

column3: Once the new set of service plans have been nailed down, this task is to make any updates that are necessary to make new plans available and remove unneeded plans.

column3: Currently the Bit Integrity Tools service, when run over a space with 0 content items, indicates a link to a report, but does not actually generate the report. This task is to ensure that a report is generated, even when no content items are in the space.

column2: 500 on Image Content Selection
column3: This bug can be seen when quickly clicking between content items with image mimetypes ('image/*') within duradmin. A 500 error is presented to the user.

column2: UI: Space counting issues

column2: SyncTool: Better handle periods of time when the DuraCloud instance is unavailable

column2: UI: Display of content items names which include #. characters

column2: SDSC Auth Endpoint
column3: This improvement is to switch the authUrl found in SDSCStorageProvider from:   "https://cloud.sdsc.edu/auth/v1.0  to:   https://duracloud.auth.cloud.sdsc.edu/auth/v1.0

column2: SyncTool --dryrun

column2: Synctool - Java7: SSLProtocolException
column3: With Java7, the following exception is thrown when trying to use the Synctool in any standard configuration: Exception in thread "main" java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not create connection to DuraStore due to Error retrieving content stores. handshake

column2: Use /mnt on EC2 Instances
column3: This improvement is to leverage /mnt on EC2 instances for temp files, at the least. /var/log/tomcat6 should link to /mnt  An analysis should also be performed to determine if /home or the webapps should use /mnt as well.

column2: Limit Tomcat logs
column3: This task is to update the log management settings for the Tomcat server on DuraCloud AMIs. These settings are contained in /etc/logrotate.d/tomcat6.  Log rotation settings should be updated to rotate on size (perhaps 256M) rather than date, and limit the

column2: Sync and Retrieval Tool metadata support
column3: This task is to update the Sync Tool and Retrieval Tool to be able to handle content tags and metadata. A DuraCloud space should be able to be pulled down to the local file system using the Retrieval Tool and pushed back up to a new DuraCloud space using

column2: Initializing an instance to use locally stored services is not working
column3: Performing an instance initialization by pointing to the local service repo (on the same host) no longer works. The issue is that the Executor in DuraBoss attempts to make calls to DuraService during initialization, but gets a 401 (unauthorized) error whi

column2: Audit Log on Space Delete
column3: This issue is that the audit log (i.e. x-duracloud-admin / audit/storage-audit-log-<space>-<time>.tsv) does not detect deleted content when an entire space is deleted.  Scenario: # Create a space # Add content to the space # Check the content manifest **

column2: Auditor not passing tests on Windows
column3: The Auditor project produces many errors and test failures when being built using "mvn clean install" on Windows. This is due to the use of colon characters in created file names (which are date based), and file path separator issues.

column2: Auditor: Log re-creation on large spaces is failing
column3: The auditor action to re-create the audit logs for all spaces is failing when being run over large sets of content. This has been seen on several instances where content within a space pushes into the hundreds of thousands of items.  One suggest reason fo

column2: Move DefaultFilter from duradmin to common.
column3: The motivation for this refactoring is to make the aforementioned useful class available to other web applications such as dfr-sync and mc.

column2: Double approval for content item deletes

column2: Audit log not updated: SDSC Restore
column3: This issue is that when Chronopolis restores content into an SDSC container, the Audit log is not updated. This is due to the fact that back-dooring the content ingest by-passes Durastore and the messaging that the Auditor depends on.

column2: Duplicaton on Demand testing
column3: Several runs of the Duplication on Demand service have failed while attempting to transfer a large content set (500,000 files) from S3 to SDSC, for Chronopolis testing.  This task is to review the failures, and perform further tests to determine the cause

column2: Duplicate-on-Demand via Inspector/Executor flow

column2: Sync Tool: CPU Utilization
column3: The Sync Tool, when run, tends to use a very large percentage of the CPU. As noted by SaaS4, running the Sync Tool continuously for 10 days kept the CPU on their server pegged at 100% the entire time.  It seems likely that the high CPU utilization is due

column2: Sync Tool: Limit local logging
column3: The Sync Tool currently generates three logs: complete.log, duracloud.log, and synctool.log. It was noted by the SaaS4 customer that these logs together took up an unnecessarily large amount of hard drive space. They noted that over 10 days, after pushing

column2: Sync Tool: Exclude list

column2: Loading throbber disappears before content item is loaded.
column3: Not a huge problem, but is slightly confusing if there is a lot of latency:  1.  click on a space and then click a content item. 2. notice that the "loading..." throbber flashes and then disappears before the new content is loaded.

column2: SyncTool: Preserve local file timestamp information

column2: Java 7 support
column3: This task is to transition DuraCloud to be built and run using Java 7. There are a few reasons for this transition:  1. Oracle has announced that Java 6 will hit end-of-life in Nov 2012 (http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/eol-135779.html) 2. Java 7 ha

column3: The reports generated by Bit Integrity Checker and Bit Integrity Bulk have incorrect headers. The header value is "space-id <\t> content-id <\t> MD5" but should be something like "space-id <\t> content-id <\t> MD5-file <\t> MD5-provider <\t> comparison-re

column3: The "Showing X of X" text at the top of the Content Item pane (with a space selected) is not always correct. Examples:  1. Select a space, notice text at top of content list: "showing 1 - 200 of X", switch storage provider, notice text is not cleared 2. S

column2: Sync Tool: Clean up log output

column2: DuraStore: Skip sending event messages for content in administrative spaces
column3: When any event occurs in DuraStore (space/content is added/updated/deleted) a message is sent. This task is to update that mechanism to skip sending those messages for the "administrative" spaces in DuraCloud (x-duracloud-admin, x-service-out, x-service-w

column2: Sync Tool: Add option to not overwrite changed files
column3: This task is to add an option to the Sync Tool which ensures that it does not overwrite any existing DuraCloud content. This means that when a file on the local file system, which has previously been added to DuraCloud, changes, it is not simply uploaded

column2: Dup-on-Change: Add an option for default duplication setting, to handle newly created spaces
column3: With the updates to the Duplicate-on-Change service for 2.1, it no longer duplicates newly created spaces. This is fine for multi-tenant instances, but not for enterprise instances, where users may be adding new spaces frequently.

column2: Download Multiple Items as a zip or tar archival file.

column2: Content properties are being overwritten when content stream changes.

column2: UI: Check box near space name

column2: Sync Tool: Hidden password option

column2: Make use of durable subscriptions for messaging connections
column3: This task is to introduce the use of durable subscriptions in place of standard topic subscriptions in order to have a better assurance that messages are not lost in the event of an interruption of a JMS connection. The failover directive, which is curren

column2: Auditor not receiving messages
column3: The auditor, as well as the service reporter (both part of DuraBoss), are not receiving messages in 2.1.1 instances.

column2: Notification email address validation needs work
column3: As reported by Dan Galewsky, the regex being used to validate the From email address in DuraBoss (which is used to send notification emails on events) does not properly handle all valid email addresses. In particular, the example provided is that setting

column2: Ability to easily share links to DuraCloud content
column3: There should be a simple way to share content that is stored in DuraCloud. Something like a "share" button/feature for spaces/content items that are stored in DuraCloud would likely work. Initially, this could just be for content in open spaces. This woul

column2: SyncTool error
column3: This issue was reported by Bryan Beecher on Dec 20, 2012. He was, at the time, using the latest Sync Tool from trunk:   I'm seeing a seemingly unending series of errors like this:  at java.util.SubList.add(AbstractList.java:652)  written to stdout/stderr

column2: Use S3 bucket tags for system space properties and remove feature allowing users to set space properties.
column3: The new Glacier storage provider brought back to light the missing ability in Amazon S3 to set properties at the bucket level. Up to this point, we have used a file in each bucket to store DuraCloud space properties, but this will not work in the Glacier

column2: Bit Integrity Tools: Service report not created for empty spaces
column3: When running the Bit Integrity Tools service over a space with 0 content items, it completes successfully with a link to a report file, but that report file does not actually exist.  Note that this is the same problem which was reported and resolved in DU

column2: Remove Space Properties and Tags in Duradmin
column3: In order to support Bill's strategy for glacier, see DURACLOUD-767

column2: UI: Expose the ability to retrieve content items from Glacier in DurAdmin
column3: DURACLOUD-754 adds the ability to use Glacier as a storage provider. Glacier requires additional steps to be able to retrieve content (as compared to other DuraCloud storage providers). This task is to expose those additional steps via the UI.

column2: Glacier: provide a way for users to perform limited file retrievals
column3: The Glacier storage provider allows for very low cost storage, but retrieval costs can add up very quickly. This task is to limit the ability of users to request content retrievals in such a way as to minimize the risk of high costs.

column2: Allow Glacier to be used as a primary storage provider
column3: This task it to allow Amazon Glacier to be the primary provider in DuraCloud, rather than Amazon S3.

column2: Pull the UpSync tool into the DuraCloud baseline
column3: This task is to copy the UpSync tool from the DfR codebase into the DuraCloud codebase in order to expose it as a DuraCloud feature and in order for ongoing development to occur.   Once transferred, the tool should be tested with DuraCloud by both technic

column2: UI: Make client-side tools easily available
column3: This task is to update DurAdmin to provide very obvious links which allow users to download the client-side tools (Sync Tool, Upload Tool, UpSync, Retreival Tool).

column2: Option for Retrieval Tool to set time stamps on retrieved files
column3: DURACLOUD-737 allows the Sync Tool to preserve local time stamp information in DuraCloud content item properties. This task is to add an option to the Retrieval Tool which will set the time stamps of files that have been retrieved (assuming that those fil

column2: UI: Handle Glacier storage state errors gracefully
column3: When content is stored in Glacier, attempts to download, view, copy, or edit the properties of that content will result in an error (http status 409). This task is to provide users with useful feedback when they attempt any of these actions on a content i

column2: sync tool include top level directory option/flag
column3: After requests from several trial and customer users, the synchronization tool should provide a configuration option/flag in which the entire directory path is included upon upload. Currently, the top level directory is ignored and not persisted in the na

column2: SyncToolUI advance config
column3: This task is to add advanced config options to the sync tool UI. In particular, the user should be able to set the connection port as well as have the ability to select a "Sync Deletes" option.

column2: Update Duracloud to the latest ActiveMQ
column3: DuraCloud has a dependency in the POM to ActiveMQ 5.2, an old version.  The version does not formally support Java 7, supported in DuraCloud 2.3.  In particular, specialized settings are needed to work with Java security.  DuraCloud 2.3 has been tested us

column2: SyncToolUI: Allow for removing sync directories in initial config
column3: Currently, when walking through the initial setup wizard of the SyncTool UI, if you select a sync directory or file accidentally, there is no way to remove it except to cancel and start the wizard over. This task is to allow selected directories or files

column2: Inconsistent Glacier Errors for Root Users in Duradmin
column3: Root users attempting to edit, copy, or edit metadata on a file in Glacier get inconsistent failure errors.

column2: SyncToolUI: Notify user that restart is required after change to configuration.
column3: Configuration tab: When changing the configuration, this does not take effect until there is a stop/start cycle of the tool. This should be indicated to the user, and an option should be provided to perform a stop/start now or to wait.

column2: UI on IE issues

column2: SyncToolUI: Allow clearing of errors
column3: This task is to provide a way, in the SyncToolUI, to clear any errors that have been noted on the errors list.

column2: SyncToolUI should expose pause/resume functions of the synctool.
column3: NULL

column2: Synctool UI should stop promptly when the user clicks "stop"
column3: Currently the tool remains in the "stopping" state until the currently active transfers are complete.

column2: SyncToolUI: Better feedback for user without write permissions on space
column3: The SyncToolUI should be updated to provide better feedback to users when they have selected a space to sync to which they do not have permissions to write to. Since there is not a simple way to collect this information up front, this task is to pay atten

column2: Shibboleth: Add 403 Access Denied Page
column3: This improvement is dependent on the Shibboleth branch.  A DuraCloud-branded 403 page should be rendered when an authenticated user who is not authorized to access DuraCloud tries to log in.

column2: Shibboleth: Logout
column3: This improvement is dependent on the Shibboleth branch. When a user logs out, he/she should be redirected to a page that specifies that complete logout requires closing the browser (ala the MC).

column2: DuraCloud instance hitting 100% disk utilization

column2: Recreate storage provider connections

column2: Space size alerts
column3: It would be useful for users to be notified when their space reaches a configurable size.  This feature would allow the users to configure this information via duradmin.

column2: When starting sync in SyncTool UI throws an error,  the error message is ugly.
column3: A more compact error description should be displayed - the large amount of text coming back in the message is breaking the look and feel.

column2: Update GlacierStorageProvider to retrieve content item storage class
column3: This task is to update the calls for getting content properties in the GlacierStorageProvider to include a call which will retrieve the storage class of each object, and include that information in the content item details. This will make it possible for

column2: Print URL to set up screen on the command line when the Sync Tool is executed in GUI mode
column3: Especially on Linux, the automatic display of the Sync Tool setup/admin screen is not reliably displayed in a browser.  Also, when is does display if there are many browser windows open it is hard to find.  It would be helpful to display the URL as a mess

column2: UI: Remove upload tool applet, reinstate single file upload
column3: Now that there is a solid UI as part of the Sync Tool, and because of the seemingly constant issues with java applet technology, the multi-file upload applet should be removed from DurAdmin and the single file upload option should be re-instated.  This wo

column2: Sync Tool: Provide feedback for Java issues
column3: There have been a variety of customer questions and issues reported in using the Sync Tool which mostly boil down to the user's system not having the necessary Java version or not having Java installed at all. This task is to provide actionable feedback t

column2: Sync Tool: Ability to restart on system reboot
column3: This task is to provide a way, on Windows, Mac, and Linux systems for a Sync Tool that is running on shutdown to restart and continue running after a system restart.

column2: S3StorageProvider: Remove dependency on a particular access key
column3: The S3StorageProvider makes use of the AWS access key as a prefix for bucket names, just to guarantee that the names are unique. The listing of buckets is also limited to only those with a matching access key.  Now that AWS does not make the secret key (e

column2: Retrieval Tool: Use logback for logging
column3: In DURACLOUD-774 (in particular, the changes in code r1072) changed over the Sync Tool from using log4j to using logback as the underlying logger. This task is to update the Retrieval Tool in the same way.

column2: add sync tool prepend source path (include top level directory) flag to synctoolui
column3: NULL

column2: Retrieval Tool: Hidden password option
column3: DURACLOUD-759 added a hidden password for the Sync Tool. This task is to make use of the same environment variable to pick up the password for the Retrieval Tool. This will help to keep the functionality of the two tools in sync.

column2: Support multiple instances of synctool ui on one machine

column2: Add CORS headers to apache config in new AMI
column3: Add the CORS headers to the apache config when the new ami is built:  See  https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/DPS-23 for modifications.  This change enables api calls to be made from javascript hosted on other domains.

column2: Remove services system
column3: This work is to remove all of the services from DuraCloud. This should include removing DuraService, the entire set of existing services, and components (like the executor) which support or depend on services.

column2: Remove ActiveMQ
column3: This work is to remove the use of ActiveMQ in DuraCloud. Storage events should be now captured by the AuditStorageProvider.

column2: Update media streaming to work without Media Streamer service
column3: The Media Streamer service is being removed. Media streaming still needs to work. This task is to allow the existing S3StorageProvider streaming Tasks handle the work the service used to manage.

column2: Create AuditStorageProvider to push AuditTasks to audit queue
column3: An AuditStorageProvider needs to be created which is a decorator for StorageProvider. This new class will capture read and write events and write them to an SQS queue as AuditTasks, to be processed later.  Note that this item overlaps with DURACHRON-35.

column2: Set up local logging to capture read and write storage actions
column3: The AuditStorageProvider already captures read and write events. This work is to have that information written out to local log files

column3: Upgrade from Maven2 to Maven3. Update POMs to be compatible with Maven3.  Fix all build warnings and errors.

column2: SyncToolUI: Option to set threads
column3: The UI for the SyncTool should provide an option to set the number of threads used for processing. This can just be a drop-down box on the configuration screen.

column2: SyncToolUI: Option to include prefix
column3: DURACLOUD-869 added a prefix option to the SyncTool. This task is to provide a way for users of the UI to make use of that new feature.

column2: Create 3.0.1 AMI
column3: Updates: - Use 3.0.1 code baseline - Add lumberjack - Update ssh users - Root pw - SSL cert update

column3: Neither parse nor format operations are threadsafe.

column2: Synctool fails when the max file size is greater than max java integer value
column3: Using the synctool, uploads of files greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE fail when the max file size is set appropriately high (ie > 2 GBs).

column2: Add SyncTool feature which allows for skipping existance checks for new content sets
column3: This feature allows initial transfers of data sets to proceed without the usual checks to see if the content is already in DuraCloud (since we know that it is not.) Instead, all files will simply be transferred.  The need for this feature comes from GSU.

column2: Beanstalk: Connect DuraStore to MC database

column2: Beanstalk: Account determination
column3: All calls going through DuraStore will need to determine the account for which the call should be processed. By default this should be done using the subdomain of the host used for the call. There should also be an optional query parameter added to each A

column2: Beanstalk: DuraStore calls to accounts
column3: All calls through DuraStore in a beanstalk setup will need to pull account information then perform the expected requests on the appropriate account.

column2: Beanstalk: Handling of roots
column3: DuraStore through beanstalk will no longer have access to a single root user. Instead it will need to allow any user with the root role to have root-level access. This work is to ensure that root user access works properly.    Since DuracloudUser has a ro

column2: Users with USER role should be able to view streams on open spaces

column2: Backup thread runs too frequently on synctool.
column3: Currently the synctool's backup thread is running on the same schedule as the directory polling period which is 10 seconds by default.  The back up thread period should not be tied to the polling period.  Instead it should run at least every 5 minutes by

column2: Beanstalk: Set up topic subscription on DuraStore init
column3: On DuraStore init, an SNS topic subscription is set up. The SNS connection details are stored in the MC DB. When a message comes through that subscription, it picks up what changes were made and updates local cache.

column2: Allow for setting chunk size in SyncTool UI
column3: The UI version of the Sync Tool should have a setting (on the configuration tab) which allows for the size of chunks to be set.

column2: SyncTool chunk size settings should be multiples of 1000
column3: In the rest of DuraCloud, GB is defined as a multiple of 1000 (a decimal representation.) The Sync Tool currently uses a multiple of 2 (decimal representation). The Sync Tool should be updated to set the GB value to 1000^3.

column2: Duradmin must use new durastore storage stats api
column3: Duradmin must use new durastore storage stats api rather than pulling, parsing and caching results in memory.      The ContentStore interface will need to be extended.   Duradmin code for parsing and caching storage reports must be removed.
